description: Data reported in Evaluating Whether Higher Utilization of Hospital Outpatient Services Contributed to Lower Readmission Rate in 2012, published in Volume 4, Issue 1, of the Medicare and Medicaid Research Review, sheds light on the question of whether the Medicare all-condition readmission rate declined in 2012 because emergency department services or observation stays systematically replaced inpatient readmissions. In 2012, the prevalence of readmission stays fell by -3.7 per-1,000 Medicare beneficiaries, while the prevalence of ED visits remained almost unchanged and observation stays increased by just 0.3. The prevalence of readmissions fell by substantially more in 2012 than any of the previous five years, but the annual change in observation stays was largely consistent over the study period.
title: Evaluating Whether Changes in Utilization of Hospital Outp..
